name: MultiElementContainer
description: The `MultiElementContainer` class is an abstract UI container component in JSMacros that provides a foundation for creating containers that can hold and manage multiple UI elements or widgets. It offers core functionality for element management, positioning, visibility control, and parent-child relationships in the UI hierarchy.
overview:
The `MultiElementContainer` class provides essential container functionality:

- **Element Management:** Add, remove, and organize multiple UI elements within a single container
- **Positioning Control:** Set and update container position and dimensions
- **Visibility Management:** Show/hide container and all contained elements
- **Parent-Child Relationships:** Maintain proper UI hierarchy with parent container delegation
- **Text Rendering Support:** Built-in text renderer for text-based elements
- **Abstract Rendering:** Customizable rendering through abstract render method

constructors.signature: new MultiElementContainer(x, y, width, height, textRenderer, parent)
constructors.description: Creates a new MultiElementContainer with specified position, dimensions, and dependencies.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the container's top-left corner

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the container's top-left corner

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the container in pixels

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of the container in pixels

parameters.name: textRenderer
parameters.description: Text renderer instance for text rendering

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the container by clearing all existing buttons. Should be called when setting up or resetting the container.
examples:
// Initialize or reset the container
container.init();

methods.name: getVisible
methods.description: Gets the current visibility state of the container.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.description: Sets the visibility state of the container and all its child elements.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Whether the container should be visible

methods.name: addDrawableChild
methods.description: Adds a drawable child element to both this container and its parent.

parameters.name: drawableElement
parameters.description: The drawable element to add (must extend Element, Drawable, and Selectable)

methods.name: getButtons
methods.description: Gets a list of all buttons managed by this container.

methods.name: setPos
methods.description: Updates the position and dimensions of the container.
examples:
// Resize and reposition the container
container.setPos(50, 25, 300, 150);

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes an element from both this container and its parent.

methods.name: openOverlay
methods.description: Opens an overlay using the parent container's overlay system.

methods.name: openOverlay
methods.description: Opens an overlay with option to disable buttons.

parameters.name: disableButtons
parameters.description: Whether to disable buttons while overlay is open

methods.name: getFirstOverlayParent
methods.description: Gets the first overlay parent in the hierarchy.

methods.name: render
methods.description: Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses to handle rendering.
